author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump signed an executive order designating Antifa as a domestic terrorist group, as his administration moves to intensify its scrutiny of left-leaning organizations following the killing of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Trump Signs Order Designating Antifa as Domestic Terrorist Group

author: Jorge Valero
description: The European Union and Indonesia have secured a trade deal that will eliminate tariffs or bring them close to zero on nearly all goods, boosting relations between the partners amid US President Donald Trump’s moves to upend global commerce.
title: EU, Indonesia Seal Zero-Tariff Trade Deal for Nearly All Goods

author: Ari Natter, David Welch
description: The Trump administration is re-evaluating a $2.3 billion loan approved by President Joe Biden for the development of a Nevada lithium deposit, according to people familiar with the matter who asked not to be named discussing internal business.
title: US Re-Evaluating $2.3 Billion Loan for Nevada Lithium Mine

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s New Visa Fee Will Hit Companies and Customers

author: Erik Larson
description: Rupert Murdoch and News Corp. asked a US judge to toss out President Donald Trump’s $10 billion libel lawsuit over a Wall Street Journal report on his alleged ties to the late Jeffrey Epstein, calling the case “an affront to the First Amendment.”
title: Murdoch Asks Judge to Toss Out Trump’s $10 Billion Epstein Suit

author: Ania Nussbaum, Ellen Milligan
description: France recognized Palestine as an independent state and, along with Saudi Arabia at a United Nations conference led by the two countries, called on Israel to end the war in Gaza immediately.
title: France Recognizes Palestine at UN Event Co-Led With Saudi Arabia

author: Erik Wasson
description: Congressional Democrats plan to meet with President Donald Trump this week to discuss ways to keep the US government operating as an Oct. 1 shutdown deadline draws closer, according to a person familiar with the situation.
title: Democrats Plan Trump Meeting This Week as Oct. 1 Shutdown Looms

author: Jorge Valero, Volodymyr Verbianyi
description: The International Monetary Fund has persuaded Ukraine’s government to significantly increase its projections of additional funding the country will need through the end of 2027 in the face of protracted Russia’s invasion, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Ukraine Accepts IMF Forecast of Bigger $65 Billion Financing Gap

author: Thomas Buckley
description: Walt Disney Co. said Jimmy Kimmel Live! will return to the air on Tuesday, ending a suspension imposed following controversial remarks its ABC late-night host made about the assassination of Republican activist Charlie Kirk.
title: Disney Says ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live!’ to Return Following Backlash

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court said it will hear a Trump administration appeal that could topple a 90-year-old precedent and put the White House in control of federal agencies that have long been independent.
title: Supreme Court Will Hear Trump’s Bid to Fire FTC Commissioner

author: Fabiano Maisonnave
description: Gabriel Escobar will visit Belem to discuss deforestation, weeks before the city hosts the COP30 climate summit.
title: Top US Diplomat in Brazil Plans Amazon Visit Amid Political, Trade Rift

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The White House has banned Iranians in New York for the high-level United Nations General Assembly meetings from shopping at Costco or buying luxury goods without US approval.
title: US Bans Iranian Diplomats at UN from Costco, Luxury Shopping

author: Brian Platt
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney said he wants to see western allies impose secondary sanctions on Russia quickly in order to dramatically ramp up pressure on President Vladimir Putin.
title: Carney Urges Secondary Sanctions on Russia to Be Imposed Quickly

author: Andrea Palasciano, Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda said Russia was testing NATO’s readiness to retaliate with its series of incursions along the the eastern flank of the alliance.
title: Lithuanian President Says Russia Is Testing Readiness to Respond

author: Matthew Malinowski, Antonia Mufarech
description: Chilean right-wing presidential candidate and front-runner José Antonio Kast on Monday rolled out plans to crack down on clandestine immigration, tapping into voter angst over an influx of foreigners.
title: Kast Vows ‘Chileans First’ in Proposed Immigration Crackdown

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: The Democratic Republic of Congo President Felix Tshisekedi said atrocities committed in the country over the past three decades met the threshold of genocide under international law and should be investigated.
title: Tshisekedi Calls Congo Atrocities Genocide, Urges Action

author: Sri Taylor
description: The Trump administration plans to allocate the roughly $2.4 billion that was stripped from California’s embattled high-speed rail to other transit projects.
title: Trump to Redirect $2.4 Billion in California High-Speed Rail Aid

author: Erik Larson, Mark Chediak
description: An Orsted A/S-backed wind farm venture off the Rhode Island coast can resume construction during a lawsuit challenging the Trump administration’s stop-work order on the multibillion dollar project, a US judge ruled.
title: Orsted Venture Wins Court Ruling to Restart Wind Farm Work

author: Erik Wasson
description: Looming federal government shutdowns have become almost routine in Washington. In March, Congress was just days away from a partial shutdown before lawmakers reached a spending deal to fund parts of the government. It was another instance of Congress putting off hard decisions until the last minute.
title: How Looming US Government Shutdowns Became Routine

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: Helen Zille, who chairs South Africa’s second-largest political party and is running to become mayor of Johannesburg, says fixing the water crisis in the nation’s richest city will be her top priority.
title: Contender to Be Johannesburg’s Next Mayor Vows to End Water Woes

author: Agnieszka Barteczko, Piotr Skolimowski
description: Prime Minister Donald Tusk said Poland is prepared to shoot down foreign aircraft that cross into its territory without authorization after a series of Russian incursions into NATO airspace.
title: Poland Threatens to Down Russian Jets Crossing Its Borders

author: Emily Nicolle
description: The UK and US will establish a taskforce designed to boost collaboration on capital markets and digital assets, part of a flurry of initiatives announced as part of President Donald Trump’s state visit to the UK last week.
title: UK, US Form Taskforce to Deepen Capital Markets and Crypto Ties

author: Andrew Kreighbaum
description: After focusing on immigration enforcement and ramping up deportations for much of his second term, US President Donald Trump has turned to overhauling the H-1B visa program, a cornerstone of the employment-based immigration system that allows US companies to hire college-educated foreign workers for specialized occupations. As of Sept. 21, new applications for H-1B visas carry a $100,000 fee.
title: Why Trump Is Charging a $100,000 Fee for H-1B Visas

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: A senior Chinese official held talks with Belarus’s president to discuss Poland’s decision to shut its eastern border with the Russian-aligned former Soviet republic, cutting off a crucial trade route for goods from China.
title: China Discusses Polish Border Closure With Belarus in Trade Hit

author: Galit Altstein
description: Israel’s push to take over Gaza City is expected to add 25 billion shekels ($7.5 billion) to the war bill through the end of the year, according to an Israeli government official.
title: Israel’s War Costs Seen Rising $7.5 Billion on Gaza City Assault

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent pledged to provide “all options for stabilization” to Argentine President Javier Milei as the South American country faces a market selloff in recent weeks.
title: Bessent Says All Options on Table to Help Milei’s Argentina

author: Sherif Tarek, Tarek El-Tablawy
description: Egypt’s president pardoned a British-Egyptian pro-democracy activist who’s been in prison for about six years, the state-run Al-Ahram newspaper reported.
title: Egypt Announces Pardon for Famed Activist Jailed for Years

author: Ben Sills
description: Russia aims to hold federal spending flat next year while weighing tax hikes to help plug a widening budget gap as fiscal pressure from the war in Ukraine continues to mount.
title: Russia Weighs Flat Spending and More Tax as War Strains Finances

author: Greg Sullivan
description: Vladimir Putin said Russia will adhere to the New START nuclear weapons treaty with the US for a year after it expires and expects a similar step from Washington.
title: Russia to Adhere to Nuclear Arms Pact for Year After Expiry

author: Ruchi Bhatia, Shruti Srivastava, Swati Gupta
description: President Donald Trump’s move to curb skilled visas for foreigners adds a fresh blow to US-India ties that only last week appeared to be on the mend, creating new hurdles for a speedy trade deal.
title: Trump’s Visa Shock Strains India-US Ties, Clouds Trade Talks

author: Sofia Horta e Costa, Paul Tugwell, Alessandra Migliaccio
description: While President Donald Trump is creating new options for the world’s wealthy to move to the US, Europe has been heading in the opposite direction.
title: Europe Residency Gets Harder to Buy as Trump Rolls Out Gold Card

author: Ania Nussbaum
description: French President Emmanuel Macron is joining international allies in recognizing a Palestinian state at the United Nations General Assembly this week, putting him at odds with US counterpart Donald Trump.
title: France to Join Calls for Palestinian State in Gamble for Macron

author: Josh Xiao
description: China has for the first time released complete footage of a successful electromagnetic catapult launch from its latest aircraft carrier, underscoring the progress in the country’s naval capabilities.
title: China Showcases Electromagnetic Carrier Catapult For First Time

author: K Oanh Ha
description: Visitors to the US arriving on student visas hit a four-year low in August, portending a grim trend for the nation’s education sector.
title: US Student Visa Arrivals Fall to Four-Year Low, Led by Asia Drop

author: Martha Viotti Beck, Andrew Rosati, Beatriz Amat
description: Credit card companies won a new and powerful ally in their fight against a competing payment system in Brazil when President Donald Trump went on the offensive against the South American country.
title: Trump’s Brazil Threats Aid Effort to Hobble Beloved Payment Platform

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: With the organization’s core values under assault, this week’s General Assembly matters more than ever.
title: A Woman as the Next UN Head May Come Down to Trump

author: Colum Murphy
description: A group of American lawmakers called for better military communication between the US and China in a meeting with Chinese Defense Minister Dong Jun, as the two countries seek to steady relations ahead of a potential sitdown between their leaders.
title: US Lawmakers Call for More Defense Talks in Rare China Visit

author: Frank Jomo
description: Early tallies from Malawi’s elections showed former President Peter Mutharika on track to reclaim the post in the first round, with incumbent leader Lazarus Chakwera trailing in distant second place.
title: Malawi’s Ex-President Takes Commanding Lead in Early Vote Count

author: Anup Roy, Subhadip Sircar
description: US President Donald Trump’s steep hike in H-1B visa fees could hurt India’s services sector, curb remittance inflows, and weigh on the rupee, economists said.
title: Trump’s H-1B Fee Hike Poses Risk to India’s Remittances, Rupee

author: Beril Akman
description: Turkey removed retaliatory tariffs imposed on some US products following a 2018 diplomatic row, before a White House summit expected to yield multibillion-dollar deals.
title: Turkey Scraps Retaliatory US Tariffs Before Key Trump Meeting

author: Philip Heijmans
description: Singapore plans to impose sanctions against leaders of Israeli settler groups or organizations responsible for acts of violence against Palestinians in the West Bank.
title: Singapore to Sanction ‘Radical’ West Bank Settlers Over Violence

author: Alberto Nardelli
description: Documents seen by Bloomberg show that tactics include recruitment of Moldovan voters abroad, organizing protests and a disinformation campaign.
title: Revealed: Putin’s Secret Plan to Hack Moldova’s Pivotal Election

author: William Horobin
description: France’s prolonged political crisis has turned the country into the euro area’s fiscal flash-point, taking over a role long played by Italy.
title: France Is Replacing Italy as Europe’s Poster Child of Fiscal Woe

author: Ott Tammik, Piotr Skolimowski
description: Estonia is set to ask NATO allies for extra air-defense assistance over the Baltic Sea as the alliance’s eastern members try to respond to the third violation of NATO airspace this month by Russia.
title: NATO Pressured to Respond to Russian Incursions of Its Airspace

author: Tom Rees
description: The UK statistics agency is embarking on a fresh purge of its published data and ramping up the hiring of economists as part of a reset to help breathe new life into its stalling turnaround efforts.
title: UK Stats Body Launches Fresh Push to Fix Data Quality Crisis

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s ruling party leadership race formally kicked off Monday under close market scrutiny, with the outcome likely to determine who will lead the nation following Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s decision to step down.
title: Japan’s LDP Leadership Race Kicks Off With Five Contenders

author: Alex Gabriel Simon
description: Indian tech stocks may decline on Monday as US President Donald Trump’s hefty fee for new H-1B visas may lead to operational difficulties for outsourcing giants.
title: Indian Tech Stocks May Drop on US Changes to H-1B Visa Program

author: Nancy Cook, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump and top Republicans mourned Charlie Kirk on Sunday and galvanized young conservatives at the memorial service ahead of next year’s crucial midterm elections.
title: Trump Mourns ‘Martyr’ Kirk as GOP Seeks to Energize Young Voters
